The image of the: Statue of Liberty" made from rubble in Aleppo was circulated widely in October 2016, but it was determined to be a piece of digital artwork created by Syrian artist Tammam Azzam in 2012.
The artist: Tammam Azzam, confirmed that the artwork was created through a photomontage on a computer and not as a physical statue.
The artist frequently incorporates well: known symbols and artworks into his work to draw attention to the conflict in Syria, as seen in his other works that superimpose famous paintings onto bombed buildings.
